532 Gallery Jaeckel
IAN HUGHES:
Vertical Wave, 2025
Acrylic on canvas
25.4 × 20.32 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$1250
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

A vertical surge of intertwining forms waves over abstract fields, modulating textures to evoke stress and shifting associations in Hughes’ “Twisted Figures” vein.

About the artist:

Ian Hughes’ paintings probe the psychological and emotional links between brain and viscera, with naturalistic forms shape-shifting over flat color-spaces. Fluid, intertwining elements suggest bodily presence and shifting associations, seducing viewers through sensuous textures and a palette of pinks, yellows, and blues modulated by whites and blacks.

Hughes lives and works in New York City. He received his BA from Yale College (1981) and his MFA from Columbia University School of Art (1984).

Hughes has had solo exhibitions including a booth at UNTITLED: Miami (2012). He has participated in group exhibitions at The Drawing Center (Selections 31), White Columns (1991), and Artists’ Space (1998, celebrating its 25th Anniversary).

View Full Artist Profile
